info.title: Inventory Management
info.description: Maintaining up-to-date inventory for your items on Walmart.com ensures a great experience for your customers and greater sales opportunities for you.

get.description: You can use this API to get the inventory for a given item.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’, '{', '}' as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The shipNode for which the inventory is requested

put.description: Updates the inventory for a given item.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’, '{', '}' as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The shipNode for which the inventory is to be updated.

get.summary: Single Item Inventory by Ship Node
get.description: This API will retrieve the inventory count for an item across all ship nodes or one specific ship node. You can specify the ship node for which you want to fetch the inventory

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’ as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: ShipNode Id of the ship node for which the inventory is requested

put.summary: Update Item Inventory per Ship Node
put.description: This API will update the inventory for an item across one or more fulfillment centers, known as ship nodes.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’ as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

post.description: Updates inventory for items in bulk. Seller Can either use feed type "inventory" or "MP_INVENTORY" * Inventory spec 1.4 feed type: inventory * Inventory spec 1.5 feed type: MP_INVENTORY Please Note: Multi Node Inventory Update Feed (feedType=MP_INVENTORY) only supports JSON Request and Responses. Refer to "MultiNode_Bulk_Inventory_Update_Request.json" for the corresponding request sample Refer to the guide section for more detailed guide around each of the feed types Refer to the throttling limits before uploading the Feed Files.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The shipNode for which the inventory is to be updated. Not required in case of Multi Node Inventory Update Feed (feedType=MP_INVENTORY)

get.summary: Multiple Item Inventory for All Ship Nodes
get.description: This API will retrieve the inventory count for all of a seller's items across all ship nodes by item to ship node mapping. Inventory can be zero or non-zero. Please note that NextCursor value changes and it needs to be passed on from the previous call to next call.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items returned. Cannot be more than 50.

parameters.name: nextCursor
parameters.description: String returned from initial API call to indicate pagination. Specify nextCursor value to retrieve the next 50 items.

get.description: You can use this API to get the current Available to Sell inventory quantities for all WFS items in your catalog. You can also query specific SKUs or filter to only items updated after a specific date in order to reduce the response size.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’ as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: fromModifiedDate
parameters.description: last inventory modified date - starting range.

parameters.name: toModifiedDate
parameters.description: last inventory modified date - starting range.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of Sku to be returned. Cannot be larger than 300.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset is the number of records you wish to skip before selecting records.

sku.description: A seller-provided Product ID. Response will have decoded value.

SupplyQuantity.description: Quantity that has been ordered by the customers but not yet shipped

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

shipNode.description: ShipNode Id of the ship node for which the inventory is requested
ShipNode Id of the ship node for which the inventory is requested

feedId.description: A unique ID, returned from the Bulk Upload API, used for tracking the feed file

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

shipNode.description: ShipNode Id of the ship node for which the inventory is requested

totalCount.description: Total number of Skus of the Seller. Example: '235'

nextCursor.description: Used for pagination to fetch the next set of items.

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

shipNode.description: ShipNode Id of the ship node for which the inventory is requested

totalCount.description: Total number of results for query.

limit.description: Information about the quantity in inventory

offset.description: Offset is the number of records you wish to skip before selecting results.

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item.

modifiedDate.description: Last changes date for the item.

availToSellQty.description: The available quantity is the quantity of an item that is available to be allocated to orders.

onHandQty.description: The on-hand balance is the quantity of active inventory stored at the warehouse.Active inventory is defined as the usable amount of an item that is in the warehouse.Inventory is active if it is not damaged, expired or being inspected.

shipNodeType.description: Identifies fulfillment aspect of invetory. Walmart, seller or 3PL fulfilled. Possible value is 'WFSFulfilled'. In later phase we will also add seller fulfilled inventory.

InputQty.description: Quantity of an item that is input by the seller

AvailToSellQty.description: Quantity of an item that is available to be allocated to orders

ReservedQty.description: Quantity that has been ordered by the customers but not yet shipped

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

accessToken.description: Header authentication with a Walmart access token, which is automatically generated using your Client ID and Client Secret. The token is valid for 15 minutes, and will be passed in the WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN header
